title.rendered: Deemed approval of GST registration resuming from 1st August -2020. Applications not approved within 3 working days would be deemed to be approved.

content.rendered:
• As Sub-section (10) of section 25 of the CGST Act, 2017 read with rule 9 of CGST Rules, 2017provides for deemed approval of application of registration after a period of three working days, if the proper officer fails to take any action on the said application within the said period of three working days.

 

    • During the lockdown period many GST Registration application pending for approval due to central / state tax offices are closed or are functioning with skeletal.so  it had been decided that the deemed approval of application of registration would not be granted on the portal with effect from 25th March, 2020. Now the lock down is over in most of the areas and offices are open since 15th June 2020, so , deemed approvals have been granted for all those applications pending as on 30.06.2020, which had not been processed till 15th July 2020.

 

  •  Many applications received thereafter which remain pending as on 31.07.2020 shall be deemed approved on 31.07.2020 and the 3 days deemed approval of application of registration would be resumed from 01st August, 2020. We may also monitor them on a daily basis till 28.07.2020, so that the pendency is liquidated.

excerpt.rendered: As Sub-section (10) of section 25 of the CGST Act, 2017 read with rule 9 of CGST Rules, 2017provides for deemed approval of application of registration after a period of three working days, if the proper officer fails to take any action on the said application within the said period of three working days.
